byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Baghdad and Mark Landler from Washington. Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad

abstract: United States will deploy 560 more troops to Iraq to help retake Mosul from Islamic State, illustrating obstacles that Pres Obama has faced in trying to lessen American involvement in wars.
snippet: The announcement, made by Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter, is the latest escalation of America’s combat role in Iraq....

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

lead_paragraph: The announcement, made by Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter, is the latest escalation of America’s combat role in Iraq.

headline.main: U.S. Will Deploy 560 More Troops to Iraq to Help Retake Mosul From ISIS
headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Deploy More Troops to Iraq to Help Retake Mosul
